author: Forrest Hanson For Dailymail.Com
title: Detroit River revolutionary war relics found | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad 'There's a world of heritage that no one yet has discovered': Guns, cars, statues and Revolutionary War relics are dredged from the bottom of Detroit River Detroit River winds for 28 miles from Lake St Clair to Lake Erie and acts as U.S-Canada border It is home to objects with have been dumped in the water since city's founding Objects include guns, cars such as a Jeep Cherokee, and 6,000-pound anchor Six 1700s-era cannons believed to be used by British military have been found since 1980s The most recent one was more than six feet long and weighed 1,300 pounds Published: 06:59 GMT, 7 February 2017 | Updated: 07:50 GMT, 7 February 2017 48 shares
